title: Homilshanski Lisy National Park
summary: Forest‑steppe of the Siverskyi Donets valley: pine woods, floodplain lakes, walking trails, picnic spots.

title: Siverskyi Donets River
summary: The region’s main waterway: sandy beaches, meanders, swimming and rafting spots (seasonal).

title: Kozacha Hora (Koropove)
summary: A tall bluff above the Donets (~60 m) with wide views. Nearby — ruins of the Zmiiv Cossack St. Nicholas Monastery.

title: Ruins of the Zmiiv Cossack St. Nicholas Monastery
summary: A 17th–18th c. Cossack monastery on Kozacha Hora; today only picturesque ruins and a memorial stone remain.

title: Bile Lake
summary: A floodplain lake between Zadonetske and Korobovi Khutory; a popular swimming and leisure spot.

title: Kamplytsia Pond (fishing)
summary: A cluster of small ponds and floodplain inlets; some areas allow paid fishing (check local rules).

title: Korobovi Khutory (Koropove)
summary: A nearby resort locality with holiday bases and river access; part of the “Slobozhanska Switzerland” area.

title: Viewpoints above the Donets near Zadonetske
summary: Sandy pine slopes overlooking river meanders; great for sunrise/sunset.
